item.title: Building Android Part 3
item.description: Ok, this is gonna be last of the basic So far we have setup the linux install to be able to build, download the source. Now, we are going to build the ROM for our device so that we can flash it. Setting the Env I’mma go straight into it and explaining as we go, go to the ROM directory where we synced it: source build/envsetup.sh or: . build/envsetup.sh Here is the breakdown, we are telling the shell to use that file to setup the enviormental variables to be able to start the build.

item.title: Building Android Part 2
item.description: “Ahh sh*t, here we go again” Ok so last time we made our linux install ready to be able to build android roms. Now we are going to download android source along with device specific sources. Repo First we are going to download a tool called Repo made by Google. It alows us to manage multiple git repos all at once. Really nice tool. So first mkdir ~/bin PATH=~/bin:$PATH Then download it and make it executeable:

item.title: Building Android Part 1
item.description: Here we Go So you decided to build android yourself? Nice. First things First: There are some requirments to build Android ROMs. As Stated by Google: A 64-bit environment is required for Android 2.3.x (Gingerbread) and higher versions, including the master branch. You can compile older versions on 32-bit systems. At least 250GB of free disk space to check out the code and an extra 150 GB to build it.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Finally Did it This is my first blog post. Well, that’s all. Catch ya later! Bye for Now!

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there My name is Muhammad Zeeshan Ahmad, more commonly known as @itexpert120 or @itexpert.120 (on XDA Developers). I am a ummm…. even I don’t know the answer to this question myself. Let’s take a step back first. I am an Android Developer, not an apps one but rather the OS one. I currently maintain a device known as Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime. I am also an aspiring Python Developer. I am also interested in Photography and Arts.

item.title: Downloads
item.description: LineageOS 17.1 Stable Builds Latest Stable Builds for LineageOS 17.1 for Galaxy Grand Prime https://www.androidfilehost.com/?w=files&flid=321629 AospExtended 7.3 Stable Builds Latest Stable AEX 7.3 Builds for Galxy Grand Prime https://androidfilehost.com/?w=files&flid=321694 All Downloads Here you can find all my builds on Android File Host https://www.androidfilehost.com/?w=files&flid=304928 (some may not boot at all. or even if they boot by accident, expect bugs) ;)
